author: Tom Nolan
title: Mysteries: Roadhouse Blues
text:
The town of Belleville, Del., in 1995 is the setting for most of “Sunburn” (Morrow, 292 pages, $26.99), the latest novel from the spellbinding Laura Lippman. Belleville (“small enough to be boring, big enough to be charmless”) is a forgettable place. But that doesn’t stop Polly Costello—a 30ish, blue-eyed redhead—from moving there and declaring it her home, and she soon lands a job as a waitress at a local roadhouse. Adam Bosk, a rugged-looking man of few words, comes to Belleville the same day as Polly. He too ends up staying—and becomes a cook at the same establishment.
The...
